verses.verse: “When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the LORD; (2 Chr. 30:27; Ps. 18:6) And my prayer went up to You, Into Your holy temple.
“Those who regard (2 Kin. 17:15; Ps. 31:6; Jer. 10:8) worthless idols Forsake their own Mercy.

But I will (Ps. 50:14, 23; Jer. 33:11; Hos. 14:2) sacrifice to You With the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay what I have (Job 22:27; (Eccl. 5:4, 5)) vowed. (Ps. 3:8; (Is. 45:17)) Salvation is of the ((Jer. 3:23)) LORD.”
So the LORD spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
(Jonah Preaches at Nineveh) Now the word of the LORD came to Jonah the second time, saying,
“Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach to it the message that I tell you.”
So Jonah arose and went to Nineveh, according to the word of the LORD. Now Nineveh was an exceedingly great city, a three-day journey in extent.
And Jonah began to enter the city on the first day’s walk. Then ((Deut. 18:22)) he cried out and said, “Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!”
(The People of Nineveh Believe) So the ((Matt. 12:41; Luke 11:32)) people of Nineveh believed God, proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from the greatest to the least of them.
Then word came to the king of Nineveh; and he arose from his throne and laid aside his robe, covered himself with sackcloth (Job 2:8) and sat in ashes.

(2 Chr. 20:3; Dan. 3:29; Joel 2:15) And he caused it to be proclaimed and published throughout Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste anything; do not let them eat, or drink water.
